snippet: Despite an increase in mortgage debt, researchers at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York find young people are continuing to retreat from the housing market.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column; Federal Reserve Bank of New York, using figures from Equifax, estimates consumers owe $8.69 trillion in mortgage debt, 2 percent more than owed year earlier; data appears to show that consumers are growing more confident, making them less likely to be behind on their bills.
lead_paragraph: Despite an increase in mortgage debt, researchers at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York find young people are continuing to retreat from the housing market.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
